title: Voting guide: Here’s what voters need to know before Boston’s Tuesday election
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Boston polls open 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. at 275 precincts for municipal election, including City Council races.
Languages available on ballots: English, Spanish, Chinese, Vietnamese; poll assistance includes Haitian Creole, Cape Verdean, Russian, Portuguese.
32,737 mailed ballots returned; not accepted at polls; voting location change: Ward 3, Precinct 9 moved to West End Neighborhood Center.

title: The Bruins’ second line is looking like a difference-maker, in more ways than one
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Bruins' second line, featuring Casey Mittelstadt, Pavel Zacha, and Viktor Arvidsson, played a key role in their 2-1 victory over the Hurricanes.
Casey Mittelstadt, once benched, has bounced back with six points over seven games, aiding the second line's recent success.
Potential trades involving Bruins forwards could be considered as the second line's strong performance bolsters the team's retooling efforts.

title: Garrett Crochet, Roman Anthony named finalist for Cy Young, Rookie of the Year Awards
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Garrett Crochet of the Boston Red Sox is a finalist for the AL Cy Young Award after leading the league in innings and strikeouts.
Red Sox rookie Roman Anthony is a finalist for the AL Rookie of the Year Award after a strong showing in 71 games.
Cy Young winner will be announced next Wednesday; Crochet competes against Detroit's Tarik Skubal and Houston's Hunter Brown.

title: Ranking top priorities for Patriots at NFL trade deadline
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots aim to add an edge rusher before the trade deadline to improve their pass-rushing abilities.
Running back depth is a concern for New England due to injuries, with potential targets including Jerome Ford.
New England has highlighted needs at linebacker and safety to address depth and injury concerns in their defense.

title: Patriots’ pass-protection issues are mounting as Drake Maye ties worrisome stat from last year
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The New England Patriots have allowed 34 sacks this season, ranking second-highest in the NFL.
Drake Maye has been sacked 12 times in the last two games, tying his total from last season.
Offensive linemen Will Campbell and Jared Wilson rank among the top 15 in sacks allowed this season.

title: Downtown Boston hotel settles discrimination complaint after woman was accused of being a man
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Liberty Hotel agreed to a settlement with Massachusetts Commission Against Discrimination after accosting Ansley Baker at a Kentucky Derby event.
Settlement includes $10,000 donation, policy updates, non-discrimination training for employees, and posting a non-discrimination statement in the lobby.
Baker and girlfriend plan civil lawsuit for punitive damages claiming false accusations and cover-up by hotel executives.

title: Falcons coach walks back ‘clapgate’ accusations after Patriots push back
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Falcons coach Raheem Morris walked back comments accusing the Patriots of simulating snap count in their 24-23 loss.
Morris initially claimed New England mimicked QB Michael Penix Jr.'s clap, leading to an early snap and penalty.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel dismissed the accusations, noting no evidence of clapping during the controversial play.

title: Alex Bregman opts out of Red Sox contract, will hit free agency
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Alex Bregman opts out of his Red Sox contract with two years and $80 million remaining.
Bregman slashed .273/.360/.462 with 18 home runs and 62 RBIs in 114 games during the 2025 season.
The Tigers and Mariners are potential suitors for Bregman, who becomes a free agent this offseason.

title: Patriots NFL trade deadline live updates: Will New England make moves before Tuesday?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots consider trading for upgrades before NFL trade deadline, exploring options like Jaylen Waddle and Alvin Kamara.
New England may trade OLB Anfernee Jennings while also possibly acquiring outside help, aiming to strengthen a 7-2 team.
Trade targets like Dolphins' Jaelan Phillips have already been moved to other teams, limiting Patriots' defense options.

title: After an eventful week, Bruins’ Hampus Lindholm has ‘a lot to be thankful for’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hampus Lindholm and fiancée Amanda welcomed their first child, named Magnolia, with meaningful ties to the couple's past.
Lindholm returned to the Bruins' lineup last week after a lower-body injury, contributing to their 5-1-0 record when he plays.
Bruins head coach Marco Sturm commends Lindholm's on-ice performance and locker room presence as pivotal to the team's success.
